# Hintergrund
Modellselektion f체r fixe lineare Modelle wird mit `MASS::stepAIC()` gemacht. Dieses Package bietet Funktionalit채t zur Zusammenstellung von Modellselektionsresultaten 체ber verschiedene Stichprobendatens채tze. Die Zusammenstellung der Resultate ist in der Funktion `collect_stepAIC_results` umgesetzt.

# Zusammenstellung der Resultate

```{r, echo=FALSE}
# get vector with sample data
n_nr_sample <- params$num_sample
s_dir_path <- params$dir
vec_sample_files <- params$filename
s_loop_part <- params$loop_part

vec_sample_dir <- sapply(1:n_nr_sample, 
                        function(x) paste0(file.path(s_dir_path, s_loop_part), x, collapse = ""), 
                        USE.NAMES = FALSE)
vec_sample_path <- file.path(vec_sample_dir, vec_sample_files)
if (!all(file.exists(vec_sample_path)))
  stop(" * ERROR: Cannot find sample data file: ", vec_sample_path)

# specify the traits
vec_reponse <- params$traits

# specify a vector with columns to be ignored (incl. the traits)
vec_ignoring_columns <- params$colnames2ignore

# specify a vector of fixed effects
vec_fixeffect_columns <- params$fixeffects
```

```{r,results='asis', warning=FALSE, echo=FALSE}
for(s_response in vec_reponse){
  
  tbl_collected_results <- collect_stepAIC_results(pvec_sample = vec_sample_path,
                                                   ps_response = s_response,
                                                   pvec_ignoring_columns = setdiff(vec_ignoring_columns, s_response),
                                                   pvec_fixeffect_columns = vec_fixeffect_columns)
  
  print(knitr::kable(tbl_collected_results, caption = s_response))
  
}
```
